hero.title: Breathing, Moving, Waiting
hero.subtitle: How Net-Zero Changes the Way We Breathe and Travel in the UK
hero.hook: Net-Zero is about more than emissions; it's about how people live in the city. Are we prepared to alter our travel patterns if the city is calmer, the air is cleaner, and our bodies are healthier?
hero.tagline: Moving more, waiting a little longer, breathing cleaner, but ultimately succeeding.

sectionB.title: Three Lines, One Story
sectionB.subtitle: Air, Movement, and Traffic: Co-Benefits Across Areas
sectionB.intro: The benefits of Net-Zero are not distributed equally across the UK's 46,426 small areas. Each line tells a story of transformation.

step1.title: Lower Benefit Areas
step1.text: About 30% of areas show low benefits across all metrics. These are often rural areas with limited infrastructure or already low pollution levels.

step2.title: Medium Benefit Areas
step2.text: 40% of areas see moderate benefits. Physical activity benefits show the highest variation, with some areas reaching over 25 million GBP.

step3.title: Higher Benefit Areas
step3.text: The top 30% of areas experience dramatic gains. These urban centers with high traffic see cleaner air translating directly into healthier, more active populations.

sectionC.title: Breathing vs. Moving
sectionC.subtitle: Do Areas with Cleaner Air Also Have More Active Movement?
sectionC.intro: Across all 46,426 small areas in the UK, a clear pattern emerges: cleaner air encourages active living. Each dot represents one community's transformation.
sectionC.insight: Despite a modest R² of 0.134, the positive trend is unmistakable. Areas with cleaner air consistently show higher physical activity benefits—reducing vehicle emissions naturally encourages walking and cycling.

sectionPopulation.title: The Human Scale
sectionPopulation.subtitle: 67 Million Lives Transformed
sectionPopulation.intro: Behind these numbers are people—breathing cleaner air, moving more freely, adapting to new patterns. Let's see who benefits most.

highBenefit.label: High Benefit Areas
highBenefit.description: People living in areas with >£5M net benefit

mediumBenefit.label: Medium Benefit Areas
mediumBenefit.description: People living in areas with £1-5M net benefit

lowBenefit.label: Lower Benefit Areas
lowBenefit.description: People living in areas with <£1M net benefit

sectionPopulation.insight: The majority of the UK population stands to benefit significantly from Net-Zero policies. Urban centers see the greatest gains, while rural areas require targeted infrastructure support.

sectionHeatmap.title: Where Are These Areas?
sectionHeatmap.subtitle: Net Benefit Across the UK
sectionHeatmap.intro: Every community has its own story. Click any area to explore the local impact of Net-Zero policies.

sectionD.title: Is It Worth the Hassle?
sectionD.subtitle: Net Gains vs Extra Travel Time: Are We Still Better Off?
sectionD.intro: Net-Zero brings cleaner air and healthier lifestyles, but what about the trade-offs? Longer travel times and changing habits come with a cost. Let's see if it's worth it.
sectionD.insight: Yes! For 70% of areas (Deciles 4-10), the benefits far outweigh the inconveniences. Even with hassle costs ranging from -1.1 to -1.8 million GBP, the top areas achieve net benefits of up to 9.5 million GBP.

breakdown.d1to3: D1-D3 (30%): Net benefit negative to near-zero. These areas need infrastructure improvements.
breakdown.d4to7: D4-D7 (40%): Moderate positive benefits (0.5-3M GBP). The transition is working.
breakdown.d8to10: D8-D10 (30%): Highly positive (3-9.5M GBP). These areas show the full potential of Net-Zero.
